content: Is it possible to have a local installation of clinFHIR?

sure - though it's up to you to support it of course :), and the install instructions are - non existent! Here's the repo: https://github.com/davidhay25/FHIRSampleCreator.

You'll need a node.js server to execute server.js, and a mongo server as well. The start page is resourceCreator.html.

Any particular reason to set up your own copy?

cheers
@David Hay There was a question about this in my project. And we might use it for more sensitive data. I'll let you know.
No worries - let me know if you want to proceed and I'll write up a short install guide.

Oh, it occurs to me that it's perfectly feasible to run it off the web and point it at a local server. At the end of this post (https://fhirblog.com/2016/10/19/setting-up-your-own-fhir-server-for-profiling/ ) there's a note about how to do that.
Thanks, this is what I was wanting to know too. I didn't realise there was a stream for it!
